intro: Panopsis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican panopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Panopsis costaricensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
